Location - perfect! Across from Target, Walgreens, directly beside a Starbucks, grocery store only a 5 minute walk (or $6 cab ride) and plenty of restaurants. The Anaheim Resort Transit was included in our package which picked us up within 1/2 a block from the entrance. The hotel has their own shuttle which is cheaper though! Its about a 5-10 minute ride depending on traffic but its a great location with lots around it!  Rooms - the rooms were nice and
Manager Response: Wow, what a great review!  I just read your review to my staff and everyone was excited that your grandparents and cousin enjoyed the special surprises we had for them.  You have a great family and we were honored that you chose to spend such an important trip with us.  Please tell everyone we said hello and we hope to see you again very soon.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel and value for money.
Summary: We stayed for 9 days in November 2010 and were completely happy with the hotel. Our daughter loved the nice heated pool, which was comfortable also for parents. Room was spacious, in good shape, clean and we could not think of anything more we would have needed. Also the fitness room was better than we expected and we used it almost daily. The breakfast was good and the weekday night suppers were ok. The inexpensive shuttle to Disney was good service. We recommend warmly and will definitely stay in this hotel again if we come to Anaheim later.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recommendation and for taking the time to share your experience.  We're happy your daughter enjoyed the heated pool as it is larger than most in the area and always a popular spot for the kids.  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit to the Southern California/Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay. Very clean & comfortable.
Summary: My new husband and I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of October.  Unlike most of the other guests, who were families, it was just the 2 of us. This trip was part of our honeymoon.  This hotel was just perfect for us.  Great location with a fantastic hotel shuttle service to Disneyland. ($3 per day). Shops directly across the road including a target, which sold water, milk, bread, toiletries and other useful things. Also, there are many restaurants in the same location, including outback steakhouse, oggies and a Starbucks.  The room was spacious. It had a separate small living area, with an L shaped couch and tv. The kitchen was very handy, including a full size fridge, microwave, stovetop etc.  The room was clean, and serviced very well each day.  Reception staff were
Manager Response: We're thrilled that you and your husband chose to stay with us as part of your honeymoon!  Thank you for mentioning the back elevator as it does not get used nearly as much as the front elevator and can be much quicker.  We hope you had a safe trip home and look forward to having you back as our guest soon.

Summary Heading: Great stay at Homewood Suites, Anaheim
Summary: Great price, friendly staff, and excellent suites.  They provided a nice breakfast and simple dinner in the evening which was very helpful to families traveling with children who wanted to keep costs down.  Shuttle stop right outside lobby door running every 30 minutes to and from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review.  I appreciate the positive feedback and look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Great Service and location for Disneyland!!!
Summary: This was a wonderful hotel to stay in. Their service was amazing and anything we needed they made it happen for us. The rooms are a great size, clean and comfortable. Their bed was so comfortable...i wish i could have bright it home with me. Great location for Disneyland. they have a private shuttle that you can ride as often as needed, back and forth from the park. They best part about our stay was that we where their celebrating our boys birthdays and they paid extra special attention to them and put together a birthday basket full of goodies and prizes!! They where wonderful....we will be staying there every time from now on.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We recently spent 5 nights at this location taking our five year old Grand Daughter to Disneyland.  We were guided to Homewood Suites by TA and we have previously stayed at their premises in New Jersey.  Simply, this is a family orientated premises, which is what we looked for when booking.  Our suite was on the 6th Floor and we could see the late night fireworks, but truth be told we were at the park most of the time.  The Shuttle Service is excellent and drivers were simply 'nice', and we met many people whilst transiting to and fro.  The meals were basic, but what do you expect for the price.  The premises are value for money when travelling with children.  The laundry was excellent.  Cheap and away from other rooms thus allowing its use at night.  Yes it is a little way from
Manager Response: What a great title for a review!  We do have some larger hotels that tower over us, but we too consider ourselves a little treasure.  Thank you for specifically mentioning Luis.  He is an amazing person and everything he does is because he really cares, not just because it's his job.  We are fortunate to have Luis and many other great associates at this hotel.  We're glad you had a great stay and our Aussie friends are always welcome here.  Come back soon!

Summary: We just returned from a trip to Disneyland. Our family of 5 stayed at Homewood suites Anaheim. The room size (1 bedroom suite) was big enough for 5 of us-2 queen beds, a sofa bed and a roll-away.  Housekeeping was fine, delivery of bed and blankets was swift. Breakfast was good- nice to have with 3 teenagers. Pool area  was very clean and had plenty of towels. Overall we had a good experience, however we cannot recommend this property because of one overshadowing event. On our way to breakfast one morning, we got onto the elevator with several other people, a few more got on at a lower floor. It was crowded, but not any worse than a work elevator we go into every day. We came to a sudden stop near the second floor. Long story short- the fire dept. had to come and work to get us
Manager Response: My staff and I are sincerely sorry that you had such an experience at our hotel.  You are correct that the elevator had a similar issue the previous week when a high school football team overloaded the elevator.  We had the elevator serviced, tested, and then re-tested after both incidents and have been assured by the experts that there are no lingering issues.  I apologize that a member of the management staff wasn't at the elevator when the fire department opened the doors.  Our Manager on Duty was on the phone with the elevator company at that time and most guests had dispersed by the time she arrived to the elevator.  Please contact me directly if there is anything that I can do to further resolve this incident for you by emailing me at joe.leinacker@hilton.com. Thank you,

Summary Heading: Great Location, Fantastic Service, Awesome Value, STAY HERE
Summary: We are travelling from Australia on our honeymoon with a young (1 1/2 years) child, we looked at reviews and websites for great value accomodation for hours upon hours, and we kept coming back to this fantastic place.  Upon reading the reviews we felt it was quite apparent that this many people cannot be wrong and thankfully we did stay at Homewood Suites.  I personally cannot fault this place!! We are staying here for 10 days, heading home tomorrow and I thought It would be best that I write the review while everything is fresh in my mind. Every person in this accomodation is pleasant and go out of their way to say hello, smile, help in any which way they can.  This makes us feel safe and that our stay is important.  We are on the 3rd floor in the middle overlooking the pool
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review!!!  We believe our hotel is THE choice for families visiting Disneyland, especially for guests staying 5+ nights.  We're thrilled we were the perfect fit for you and hope to see you again very soon.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: Return trip to this hotel for disneyland visit
Summary: This was our 2nd visit to this hotel staying 2 nights. We were greeted and given a early check in which we really appreciated as we were going to Disneyland this day and wanted to utilize the park as much as we could for the 2 day park hopper.  We had the larger one bedroom suite  this time and it did give a litlte more room in the seating/tv room. It was very clean as always.. We enjoyed the light dinners in the evening and utilized them by leaving park to go back to hotel freshen up and have bite to eat. This also saved $ on buying park food. Many families like ourselves did not go back in the evening to Disney as too exhausted so enjoyed the pool time. The kids all played and made friends by the pool and enjoyed themselves as parents got to mingle . We looked foward to this
Manager Response: Thank you so much for giving us this review......on your second stay!!!!  We're glad your second experience was just as good as your first and that we could once again be a part of your vacation.  Hope to see you back for a third time next year!

Summary Heading: Lived up to all the great reviews!!
Summary: I am very happy I read all the reviews of Homewood Suites on TripAdvisor!! This was an absolutely great find for a group of 4 friends looking to enjoy Disneyland, California Adventure, and general time around the greater Los Angeles area.  This is not a luxury resort hotel, but it provided us with things we wouldn't even have gotten at a 4 or 5 star resort!   First off, excellent service. Everyone was SO friendly, literally everyone. I felt so comfortable and safe in this hotel. They provided us everything we asked for, and with a big smile that truly seemed genuine.  The pool area was moderately sized, but very clean and a lot of fun. My friends and I had a lot of great evenings spent by the hot tub and pool.  The proximity to Disneyland was awesome, with cheap and reliable
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post this review.  I think you have done a great job in describing the experience at our hotel and given the readers an accurate snapshot of what to expect when staying here.  It means a great deal to my staff and I that our hotel played a part in lasting memories for you and your friends.  We hope you stay with us next time and we're going to do whatever we can to get that elusive 5th star!  Thanks again.

Summary: We just came back from a wonderful 2 week stay at the Homewood Suites in Garden Grove.  We've both stayed in Anaheim many times, including hotels that surround this one (Crown Plaza, Hyatt and Marriott Suites).  This is my new favorite hotel in the Anaheim area!  I did quite a bit of research for a good quality hotel at a reasonable price (we sometimes do Priceline, sometimes not) and I had my heart set on the Homewood Suites once I read the reviews.  The check-in was friendly and went smoothly.  We were told there were only 1st floor rooms but they could move us up to another floor the next day if we chose to.  We were originally going to take her up on that, but noticed that guests were waiting for an elevator and it just seemed easier to stick with the first floor.  We
Manager Response: I am always impressed when someone takes this much time to give a detailed review of the hotel (and I'm not just saying that because it was a great review).  Your experience is exactly what we attempt to deliver for every guest at the Homewood Suites Anaheim.  And while I appreciate you giving me the credit for how well the hotel runs, all of the credit goes to my staff; the hardest working staff in Anaheim!  Come back and see us soon.

Summary: Stayed here in June for 5 nights to visit Disneyland with 2 children.  Chose this hotel from the reviews on Tripadvisor and also because we were able to get a room with 3 beds, 2 queen and a sofabed at a good price including breakfast.  The room was quite comfortable and the beds good.  The kitchen we thought we would use but didn't.  Overall a reasonably spacious room witha view over the pool.  What we found most disappointing was the cleanliness in the halls and lift  as well as the food.  For several days the lift floor was really filthy as though something was spilt on it and not cleaned.  The breakfast/eating area was remarkabley clean though.  But I really loathe the use of paper plates for the meals with plastic cutlery and the huge bins in the dining area.  Its like
Manager Response: I'm sorry we didn't live up to your expectations.  I have shared your feedback with my staff and we will continue to try to improve in the areas that you felt that we fell short.  I hope you still enjoyed your vacation and thank you again for sharing your experience.

Summary Heading: Found our new home, when visiting Disneyland!
Summary: My family and I stayed at the hotel while visiting Disneyland and we loved it! I was a little nervous after reading the most recent reviews but am glad that we still stayed at the hotel. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The kitchen was great, I didn't cook but it was great to have the LARGE refrigerator not a mini one. We were able to buy snacks and store them. The two TV's made life easier, not fighting over what to watch. Breakfast was great and the Manager reception/ dinner was good. I've stayed at other suite hotels that offer Manager reception and all that they offer is chips and dip or little snacks. The hotel does not offer a steak dinner, but we enjoyed the hotels dinners a few nights and had our steak dinner at an over priced local resturant. The hotel may not have
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review and for the compliments about the staff.  I've written it on here before, but our staff does genuinely care about our guests and we take our role in your vacation serious.  You're right, the lighting in the public dining area and near the main elevator is a little dim and we expect to have new lighting installed in the next 2 weeks to brighten these areas.  Thank you for your feedback.  It really does make a difference.  I hope to see you again real soon.

Summary Heading: Excellent value for Money..... Loved it
Summary: I spent months planning out or trip to Anaheim from Australia and I am also an avid researcher on Trip adviser prior to booking anything.  This hotel exceeded my expectations...We were traveling with a 7 year old and a 15 year old (15year old loved the free WI FI)  1. we arrived at the hotel st 9.30 am after a very long international flight and I was very sick with a migraine. The staff were more than accommodating for us and as our room was ready checked us in  straight away at no extra charge.  2. we booked a corner suite (larger) one bedroom with 2 queen beds. This room was perfect (apart from the noisy air con vent in the bedroom). Beds were very comfortable and lounge area was large enough to relax after a very busy days at the theme parks  3. Shuttle bus was excellent only
Manager Response: Wow!  A perfect holiday!  I'm thrilled that we could be a part of it.  I think it's great that you did so much research planning your trip and I'm honored that you chose to stay with us.  We hope to see you again next year.

Summary: We had a great stay at Homewood Suites. We found the rooms large enough for a family of 4, and were clean and quiet. We especially enjoyed making our own waffles for breakfast and the suppers were great after a long day at Disney. The staff was really friendly and efficient. The pool was clean and there were plenty of towels. The shuttle bus to Disney got pretty full at times, but it was usually on time. We would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: We're glad you had a great stay!  We aim to provide a clean, comfortable suite that allows you to thoroughly relax and enjoy your vacation.  We look forward to your next visit....and we'll be sure to have the make-your-own waffle station ready for you.

Summary: My husband and I loved this hotel. We stayed 6 days with our 2 year old daughter. The room was fantastic-much larger than expected, clean and comfy. Being pregnant and on a special diet, I appreciated the kitchen amenities and was also blown away by the helpful staff when we requested certain items. The kitchen area also dubbed as our remote office-great space.  My daughter has allergies and the staff followed all of my instructions before our arrival. They were also very helpful when I requested all the outlets be covered right away.  The location is fantastic, I especially loved the Target within walking distance, there were a few things we forgot and it was so nice to walk across the street and pick them up.  The staff was always helpful and smiling, even when our 2 year old
Manager Response: Thank you for the very kind review.  For any future guests, please let us know if we can assist or take special care to help you with any allergies or dietary needs.  We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: booked this hotel based on the amazing tripadvisor reviews, and i am completely perplexed as to why the reviews are so positive. overall, it was a reasonable experience, and i paid a low price (less than $100 booking direct), but i regretted staying here. should have stayed at the doubletree suites, which was just a few dollars more.  our hotel room smelled like mildew just when entering. the evening manger's reception made me ill - i consider the food totally inedible - so would not even count this as an added amenity (fake chicken patties, everything seemed either straight out of a can or the freezer and there is no selection)  there was also a lot of street noise, even though i specifically asked for a quiet room  yes, i probably should have asked for another room, but my
Manager Response: I appreciate you giving your feedback on TripAdvisor.   I regret that we didn't live up to your expectations.  For all future guests, please let us know while you are still here if there is anything is falling short of your expectation.  We will do anything within reason to make this not only a comfortable stay, but a memorable one.  We encourage open communication throughout your stay and always relish an opportunity exceed your expectations.

Summary: Hotel is rated a category 5 but it is definately not! I would not even give it a rating. It was awful!! Staff was very nice but entire hotel needs to be redone. Rooms are dark, dingy, and dirty! Carpets are so stained you don't want to put your feet on them. The hallways have such ripples in the carpet someone is going to trip and really get hurt. You spend a very long time waiting for the elevators. It was NOT a good experiance. Stay anyplace but here!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the hotel.  I appreciate the positive comment about my staff as they are a great group of people.  While we do clean our carpets regularly due to the high volume traffic and the fact that the many children we have stay at this location can sometimes have some spills, we are in the process of re-cleaning the carpet throughout the entire hotel as this is the 2nd review that noted a stain.  I encourage all potential guests to review the photos of the hotel on TripAdvisor as I don't personally feel that our suites are dark and dingy.  Please contact me if I can be of further assistance at joe.leinacker@hilton.com.

Summary: We booked this hotel based on the positive reviews it received on TripAdvisor. BIG MISTAKE!! When we got to our room, the AC was not working, the room was very hot and stuffy, we called the front desk and a tech came up and tried to fix it, a few hours later, the room was freezing. Couldn't adjust the tem in the room, the only way was to turn the AC on or off, and when it was on, the fan was so loud, you can't really sleep. The rooms were very small and dingy. The bathtub had mold in the corners, the carpet in the elevator, hallways and rooms were so dirty you didn't want to step on it with your bare feet. This was supposed to be a once in a lifetime vacation with our children, instead, all they can talk about is how terrible the hotel in Disneyland was!! Don't stay here, stay
Manager Response: On behalf of my entire staff, I apologize that you had such a terrible vist to our property.  I would greatly welcome the opportunity to get more information regarding your stay.  As you can tell from the many other reviews on TripAdvisor, this is not the normal experience.  I welcome the opportunity to hear from you at your earliest convenience by either email (joe.leinacker@hilton.com) or on my direct phone number (714-620-2153).

Summary: Whenever my family travels to Cali, we stay here.  It isn't as large or glamorous as other hotels, but is perfect in so many ways.  I stay here with my family, my parents are both age 50+, my brother 32, and myself 28.  We all live in separate states, but once a year meet in California on a family trip to see family and do Disneyland.  The hotel is fantastic with awesome staff that are quick to help you with anything you may need.  They have a managers happy hour with free snacks and beer/wine.  Wish you had something other than Bud on tap though, I work for Miller/Coors Brewing.  Very ample parking and huge pool area.  The rooms are enormous compared to the other resorts in the Disney area, and are half the price!!  I highly recommend this hotel.  Only one complaint, only two
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind words.  You're absolutely right, our hotel is in the shadows of some larger hotels around us, but we consider ourselves a hidden gem.  If you're looking for hotel that you can have all the comforts of home in regards to space, convenience, and a relaxing atmosphere (but not have to do the cooking and cleaning), then the Homewood Suites by Hilton Anaheim Main Gate is for you.  Thanks again and come back and see us soon!

Summary: We expected so much based on the excellent reviews. But, ghetto is what comes to mind. Apparently there was a lot of water damage and they have the 6th floor under major reconstruction , unfortunately that's where our room was. Construction equipment in halls, curtains hanging out windows, plastic wrap all over, wallpaper coming off walls and on Thursday a huge cloud of something floating in the air, my call to the front desk was politely taken, but my request for a call back never was realized. Rooms were very small, had a 2 bed room suite since there were 4 adults and 3 kids, but the rooms were so small. Also, our end of the floor looked like it had not been done over recently - it looks really worn out. No enough room for us to eat together or even sit at the same time. I
Manager Response: Needless to say, my entire staff and I feel terrible that this was your experience during your recent stay.  I regret that the water damage had a negative effect on your stay, as well as others during this time; thankfully the work that was being done is now complete.  Our property was renovated in 2009 and most guests tell us they appreciate the extra space in our suites compared to our competitors, but I'm sorry this wasn't to your liking.    I would like to the chance to see if I can make this up to you.  Please contact me at joe.leinacker@hilton.com at your convenience. Sincerely,

Summary Heading: Good spot for a Disneyland visit
Summary: Looked at the broad choice of hotels near Disneyland.  Chose this one based on a few important factors: preference for Hilton properties, previous experiences with Homewood Suites were positive, decent rate, free breakfast, proximity to Disneyland. Here's where it delivered: proximity to Disneyland was great, availability of shuttle to Disneyland was a big bonus, breakfast buffet had good choices for everyone, staff was very nice and accomodating. Here were the issues: when we arrived they were able to get us checked in early.  As we approached our room, we discovered that the room they assigned us was in the middle of a construction site: nails on the floor, carpet ripped up making the hallway sticky, wallpaper coming off the walls.  We immediately requested a new room. Not
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive rating despite an experience that fell far short of the typical what we promise to deliver at this property.  We did have some water damage due to someone setting off a sprinkler head which was the cause of the walls looking less than attractive and I will follow up on the issue with your suite.  Fortunately, the recovery and "construction" from the water damage are complete.  I would love the opportunity to speak with you further regarding your experience and see if I can resolve this issue and get another opportunity be your hotel of choice on your next visit to the Anaheim/Orange County area.  Please contact me at joe.leinacker@hilton.com. Thank you,

Summary: We just returned from a nine day stay at Disneyland.This was our 3rd year in a row that we have vacationed at Disneyland.This hotel was by far the best one that we have stayed at in the three years. The staff were very friendly-I wish i could remember their names,but I can't-they always had a greeting for us when we came through the door.The breakfast and the supper that they offer was really nice.It eliminated a lot of eating out which made us happy. The room was very nice and the beds very comfortable. This is the hotel that we will stay at for our future trips to Disneyland.
Manager Response: We love that this was the best hotel you've stayed at in the area!!!  Our hotel may be a little smaller in overall size compared to some of the other big hotels around us (although our suites and pool area are much larger), but this allows us to deliver much more personal service and ensure you have a great stay.....we're glad you did.

Summary Heading: Simply the best service, facilities and location in the Disneyland Area
Summary: My wife and I with our 4 kids (13, 11, 9, 9) are currently staying with the friendly team here at Homewood Suites Anaheim since 28Jul10. We are here until 19Aug10.   THE SUITE: The rooms are, in my view, a five star rating. They are extremely spacious and the 2 x queen size beds in the separate bedroom are some of the most comfortable I have ever experienced (and I do travel a lot). The suites are modern, they have a good sized fridge, a dishwasher, microwave oven, an L-shaped comfy lounge suite, dining table, 2 x large LCD TVs, plus heaps more.  THE BREAKFAST: The provided breakfast changes daily and consists of eggs, sausages, ham, waffles (make them fresh yourself at waffle stations), breads (toasters), bagels, muffins, yoghurts, cereals, porridge, plus heaps more. There are
Manager Response: John, When you told me at breakfast that you had typed up something at the pool for TripAdvisor, I thought maybe you were kind enough to write a few words regarding your experience, but this is an amazing review!  I'm most proud of the service that you wrote you have received while being a guest with us for the past few weeks.  The people that work at this hotel are an exceptional group and greatly appreciate you noticing their efforts.  I hope you enjoy the rest of your stay and please let me know if you need anything. Best wishes,

Summary: We spent the last few days of our Californian adventure in Anaheim and chose well with  Homewood. The room was comfortable and cleaned daily (including our dishes!) We used the pool downstairs and enjoyed having more space compared to previous hotels where you had to wait to even find somewhere to sit.  Even though you are further from Disneyland than other hotels, the shuttle service was always quick and reliable and helpful with directions.   We enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and supper although at times the range was fairly limited. Still, can't complain when it is free!  The biggest surprise was having free internet, a change from our whole holiday where we have been paying some huge prices for hotel internet.  So overall very pleased with our stay here and would
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed the amenities of the hotel including the free wireless internet.  We believe the value we offer to our guests is as good if not better than any hotel in the area and we're delighted you feel the same.  Thank you.... and come back soon!

Summary Heading: We have stayed at a lot of the hotels in...
Summary: We have stayed at a lot of the hotels in and around DL. There is a lot that goes into deciding which one is the right one for you. Some are closer to the park, offer breakfast, offer a shuttle, have nicer accommodations, a nicer pool, etc. So it is hard to compare. What every hotel should have is great service, clean accommodations, and plenty of parking.  We enjoyed the breakfasts, our suite was nice, service was good and all around it was a decent experience. Nothing really jumped out as being exceptional. Aside from some work being done on our floor that made the hallway stink and a bus full of high schoolers crowding the food and eating area I would consider staying here again.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for taking the time to come on tripadvisor and share your experience.  Our goal is to ensure every guest has an exceptional stay and it seems as though we fell a little short during your visit.  I apolgize for the work being done on your floor.  We had a guest that hung some clothing on a sprinkler head in their suite and set it off flooding some of our sutes.  The repair work should be complete soon and although any affected suites are out of order for repair, a few of the hallways were an eyesore.  We hope that you will give us another opportunity to make this a memorable stay on your next visit.  Please contact me personally at joe.leinacker@hilton.com if there is anything we can do to ensure a return visit.

Summary: We had a four night stay here from June 29th whilst doing local theme parks and Universal Studios.  We have stayed at this property in Seattle and were similarly impressed with Anaheim.  Staff were very pleasant and helpful during what was a busy time.  We had two rooms side by side as our adult children were next door.  Our rooms were quiet and very clean.  We wold stay again.   It was good to have laundry facilities. The homemade cookies when we came home one evening were just yummy! We were surprised to be using disposable plates, cutlery etc at breakfast - this was not our experience in Seattle as proper crockery was used, but we realise that this may be due to economic reasons.  Breakfast choice was a little more limited than we had previously experienced.  Breakfast staff
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving the positive review about your stay here.  We have been getting quite a few guests from New Zealand and it means a lot to us that you searched, found, and chose us for such a big trip. I must apologize for the experience with the business center computers.  We attempt to closely monitor the computers to prevent people from playing games and delaying others from using the computers for the intended use (i.e. check email, stay in touch with friends and family, get directions, print tickets/boarding passes, etc.).  If you are a guest with us and experience this issue, please let us know and we will be more than happy to have the situation addressed or at least bring you in the back office to use one of our computers. Thanks again for the great feedback.

Summary: We stayed here for 5 Nights in June 2010 and it was one of our best stays in a Homewood Suite by Hilton. The Check In was very easy and friendly. Our Suite was very nice, clean and everything was on its right place. The breakfast area was a little bit busy in the morning, because a lot of families are staying in this hotel. But the staff in the morning was so fix to clean up the tables that there was no problem to find an empty and clean table. The afternoon snack was very delicious and it is a great idea from Homewood to serve some snacks and free wine, beer or some drinks for the kids. GREAT!!! Thank you very much for the great staff in your hotel and this means the reception, housekeeping and all other people who work there. You all did a great job!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for not only sharing your experience, but adding some photos as well.  I can tell by the photos that you had one of our suites that end in either 00 or 01.  These rooms have a great view and are a little larger, but some of them are accessible suites like yours was and only has the mini-fridge, as opposed to the rest of our suites that have a full-size refrigerator. I'm always very appreciative of the kind words about the service our staff delivers on a daily basis.  We have a great group of associates here and are lucky to have them work for us. We hope to see you soon! Best wishes,

Summary: I didn't stay  at this property but it is right across the parking lot from the Mariott Suites Garden Grove. The hotel looks updated and the pool outside is nice. There weren't any special rates at the time I booked for my vacation. By the looks on the outside of this hotel it appears to be very nice. All the hotels in this immediate area has been upgraded and renovated. If you choose this hotel I personally believe you will have made a good choice. The Mariott Suites, Hampton Suites, and Homewood Suites, Embassy are all really nice hotels as far as rooms. If having an onsite restaurant, free internet, room service, full kitchen, game room, free parking, and other amenties like that then that's how you can figure out which hotel is right for you and your family. Location is
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your perception of the hotel on tripadvisor.  We appreciate your comments about the advantage and convenience of staying in Garden Grove on your visit to Disneyland.  We hope that you stay with us at the Homewood Suites on your next trip. Thanks again,

Summary Heading: We found our home away from home for our Disneyland trips!
Summary: I did several weeks of extensive research, even creating a matrix in excel, to select a hotel for our family's first-ever Disneyland trip.  Homewood topped the list for all amenities I was looking for and the reviews here are spot-on.  We have found our home away from home for our future Disneyland trips.  We loved our experience with Homewood and will be back next year!
Manager Response: We're honored and impressed that your thorough research led you to stay with us here at the Homewood Suites Anaheim.....and pleased that we lived up to your expectations.  This hotel really does offer a complete set of amenities for your stay whether you're visiting Disneyland with the family or in the area on business.   I would love to see the matrix you created.  If possible, please send it to me @ joe.leinacker@hilton.com. Best wishes and we'll see you on your next trip!

Summary Heading: The place to stay for Disneyland!
Summary: We've traveled to Disneyland a dozen times over the past 5 years w/ our children and stayed at most of the popular hotels and gotten to know the area well.  Marriott and Hilton at the Convention Center, multi-times at Embassy Suites South, Doubletree Suites and last time at the BW Park Place Inn (closest hotel to the park.)  We didn't like the room size at the Marriott or Hilton, Embassy is getting a little ragged and needs remodeling, the Doubletree was very nice but, like the others, uses ART for transportation (which flat out sucks!) and the BW was too grungy for our tastes.           Finally, we've found the right place to stay for our Disneyland trips.  The Homewood Suites is a Hilton brand w/ a lot of bang for the buck, especially for families.  You get a kitchen, small
Manager Response: We are so happy that you had such a great experience at the Homewood Suites Anaheim.  It means a great deal to us that you recommend our hotel after staying at many other hotels in the area.  I am very lucky to have a staff full of great people like Edlyn working at this hotel.  Our staff genuinely cares about our guest's experience and we will always go out of our way to create a special memory for you and your family.  We can't wait to see on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Look no further!  You have reached your destination...
Summary: We've stayed at the Homewood Anaheim/Garden Grove for numerous Disney trips, the last one being a few years ago.  It instantly became our favorite, and only, choice for stays near the Parks - and now it's even better.  I'm sure a great deal of the credit goes to Joe Leinacker, the general manager.  Joe should be the model for all hotel managers and managers-in-training to emulate - he has it all when it comes to hospitality and people skills, and is a genuinely kind and caring person.  He took great care to accommodate two special requests I made for changes to our reservation just hours before we were to check in, and made an emergency situation much easier to deal with. Joe completely rocks!  He has my vote for hotel manager superhero status.  Anyway, now that we're clear on
Manager Response: I am speechless after reading review.  Your kind words are the reason why most of us are in the hospitality industry.  We were happy to accomodate your special requests and will continue to do whatever we can to make this a wonderful experience for our guests.  We can't wait to see you next time.

Summary: As there are already plenty of good reviews with postive feedback below (and we agree with them), we will not repeat it here but will highlight what we like most and least about this hotel. We stayed at the hotel with our 2 year old son so our review focuses on this aspect.  POSITIVE EXPERIENCE: Compared to Marriott Suites that is next door and where we stayed before, we liked this hotel better for: - Its functional room with fully fitted kitchen and L-shaped sofa even if the room's size is a bit smaller than Marriott's. We took breakfast back to the room on most days so that we could eat it at a more leisurely pace, especially with a small child. - The room's walls also seemed to be more soundproof as we did not hear much noises from next door. - The pool area is bigger and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and taking the time to put both the positive and the "less positive" aspects of your stay.  We think it's great that the suites met most of your needs and you liked our large pool area and complimentary meals.  As mentioned in other reviews, the front elevator is most often used by our guests and at busy times there can be a wait, however, the back elevator is a much faster alternative for anyone staying towards the back of the property.  We have designed the hotel to feel like a "home away from home" and hope that was your experience as well.  Hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay ,first time at Homewood Suites
Summary: Our party of four families visiting from Honolulu stayed at the Homewood Suites from May 26 thru May 31st, excellent front desk service, everyone was pleasant , rooms were very clean and spacious, the complimentary breakfast buffet is a great amenity ,hot food,cereals, bagels,everything a family needs to get up and go in the morning, not to mention the free 24hr business center to print out your boarding passes or check your email. I would highly recommend this hotel for a family vacation.
Manager Response: We're glad you enjoyed your first visit to the Homewood Suites Anaheim.  Your second stay will be even better!  Hope to see you soon.

Summary: We stay at this hotel everytime we visit the area.  The staff is always welcoming and friendly.  No matter the time you arrive, they always have a smile on their faces :o)  The rooms are very clean, breakfast is great, and the pool area is inviting, yet relaxing.  Whenever we head to Disneyland, I get asked by our children, "Are we going to our FAVORITE hotel?"  Cheers are heard when we say yes!  Thank you for always making us feel welcome!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Outstanding Staff Makes This an Outstanding Hotel
Summary: When we arrived at this hotel, we thought it looked fine.  The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful.  When we got to the room, it was pretty clean but a bit worn.  But over the next two days, we observed and became awed by the near herculean effort on the part of all the staff to keep up with how much abuse a hotel can be subjected to by the hordes of disney-goers coming and going all day long.  And not only did they keep up after them, they did it with a smile and a big hello.  I've never been greeted so politely and so friendly by the staff at any hotel before.  The breakfast was very good, especially considering how many people had to be fed at once.  And the light dinner was also very good.  We would definitely stay here again.  Our only comments were that
Manager Response: Thank you so much all of your kinds words about our staff.  We have a great group of people working here at the Homewood Suites Anaheim, most of which have been with us for a very long time.  I do need to apologize for the lack of hot water one morning; we did have an unexpected power outage to the boilers that we were able to fix right away, but some guests were impacted.  Please let me know the next time you are coming to our area.  We can't wait to see you again!

Summary Heading: We won't stay anywhere else when coming to Disneyland!
Summary: This is our third stay at this wonderful property and it just keeps getting better!  Louis gave us excellent customer service both on the phone before arriving (this was a completely spontaneous trip planned at the last second!) and when we got to the front desk.  I've never had anything but very good customer service here.  We haven't stayed here in a couple of years and they have renovated the whole hotel.  Completely new furniture in the rooms and in the common areas downstairs.  It's kind of a retro, modern look and everything was very comfortable.  I especially liked the couch they put in the family room area of the units.  It's an L sectional and gives a lot of seating for a small space!  There was also an ottoman with a removable tray at the end of couch, so it was out of
Manager Response: Thank you for the very detailed and complimentary review.  This means a great deal to us especially coming from someone that has been as active on this site as you.  We look forward to seeing you on your next trip to the Anaheim/Orange County area.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: What a great place to stay when going to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel had it all. A great staff, a pool and hot tub that were very clean, a breakfast buffet that fills you up, you can even make waffles. The room was very spacious and the rooms are seperated by a door. The teens could be in their room and parents could go to sleep in their room. They have a great shuttle to Disneyland. Lots of restaurants very close. Just watch the address, They are actually on Chapman not Harbor Blvd which is confusing. Maid service was excellent also.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review and for noting our proximity to Chapman as it can be a little confusing with our physical address listed as Harbor Blvd.  For future guests, if you are at the intersection of Harbor Blvd. and Chapman, we are located just behind Outback Steakhouse.  Specific directions can be found on our website or can be obtained by calling the hotel directly at (714)740-1800.  Thanks again!

Summary Heading: We only stay at the Homewood Suites at Garden Grove
Summary: As usual we had a wonderful stay at the Howewood Suites at Garden Grove.  As a family we travel to the USA a couple of times a year and we make sure we stay here when we come to LA.  It is close to Disney and offers all the amenities of home whilst traveling.  If you have a car you can get around very easily while based here...  The staff are some of the best in the business, they are very polite and could not be more helpful during your stay!  A big thanks to Silena, always accommodating and along with the front desk team very freindly.   As we have become regulars we are always warmly greeted and welcomed back like good friends now...We do feel like it is our second home in LA.  The amenities are excellent, the daily Breakfast's and Manager's reception between Sunday and
Manager Response: Chris, Vicki, and Jacqui, Thank you for the review and for continuing to come back and stay with us.  You're right, we are your 2nd home!  I just read your review to Silena and she said "I bet that's Chris from Australia" before I could even finish reading it!  We hope you have a good half year until we see you again.  Take care mate!!!

Summary: Our purpose for staying at this hotel was to visit Disneyland. The staff were all very friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. The walls were a bit thin and you could hear the family next door who were loud when they were awake! The beds were very comfortable. We caught the shuttle up to Disneyland and back, you buy the shuttle tickets at the front desk. Breakfast was included and a bonus was the manager's reception which was held from Monday to Thursday 5-7pm and also included a light meal which did us fine for dinner before going back to Disneyland in the evening. Their high speed internet was excellent when you could get on to use it! We had a room that also faced Disneyland so we could see the fireworks at night when we were at the hotel. We would definitely stay there
Manager Response: Thank you for the review.  I'm glad you were able to take advantage of the evening reception which includes a light meal.  It's a great way to save money and at the same time take a much needed break after a long day at the parks.  Hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: WOULD NEVER STAY ANY WHERE ELSE!!
Summary: I booked a trip to Disneyland and decided to stay at this hotel.  First off, after a long flight from Canada we were welcomed with smiles and open arms as if we were family.  The room was more than we expected.  I am a very picky when it comes to everything being clean and it exceeded my expectations (which is very hard to do!!)  We spent 7 days at Disneyland and after long hot days it was wonderful to come back to the hotel to a nice meal, fresh towels and linens, a tidy room and the very nice pool.  Target is within walking distance which helps for extended stays and picking up snacks or anything else that you may need.   This was our home away from home and I will NEVER stay anywhere else.  THIS IS THE PLACE TO BE!!!!
Manager Response: What a fantastic recommendation!!!!! I may be a little biased, but I agree with you 100%!  Thank you for noting what a great job our Housekeeping Department does on a daily basis.  Is there anything better than coming back to a clean, well made suite after a long day at Disneyland?  We can't wait to see you next time!!!!!

Summary Heading: Pleasant friendly accommodating staff--clean rooms comfortable beds
Summary: This is the best place to stay when in this area -- clean rooms with extra pillows and comfortable beds -- friendly staff -- can't beat having breakfast before leaving in the morning and the free wine or beer with dinner on Mon - Thurs was a plus.  I would recommend this place to anyone going to Disneyland with young children to grandparents.  Thanks to the staff for making us feel at home.  I didn't want to leave.  I will be back again.  Thanks!
Manager Response: We are thrilled that you felt like you were at home during your stay with us!!! As far as we are concerned, that is the nicest compliment we could receive.  We hope to see you back soon!

Summary Heading: Check in issues, but otherwise a good stay.
Summary: This is our second stay at the Homewood Suites in the past 18 months.   On my last visit I gave 5 stars, this time due to check in hassels our stay is down to 4 stars.  Our reservation was for a non-smoking two queen, accessible room with grab rails for the shower/bath.  The initial room we were sent to was on the 7th floor.  Normally wouldn't be an issue but the 7th floor is the smoking floor, when we asked at time of reservation for non-smoking.   I returned with our luggage to the ground floor to receive another room assignment on the ground floor.    It was non-smoking, however even though our travel comfirmation had grab rails noted there were none in the room.     A few phonecalls later and we were advised that we would be moved the following day.  The first room we stayed
Manager Response: On behalf of the front desk staff, I sincerely apologize for your experience and the delay in getting you into the suite you had reserved.  We prepare for our arriving guests each and every day to ensure we get you the room you reserved and I regret this was not the case for your stay.  If possible, please call me at 714-740-1800 or email me at joe.leinacker@hilton.com as I would like an opportunity to make this up to you.  I'm glad that other than this initial mistake, you had a good stay and hope you will consider us again on your next visit to the Anaheim/Orange County area.

Summary: WE just got home from a family trip to Disney and we loved our stay at Homewood. Stay were pleasant and helpful. Great value. We will tell people about this gem.  Thanks!
Manager Response: Thank you for coming on TripAdvisor and sharing your experience.  We're glad you found us and look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary Heading: Was a pleasant place to stay
Summary: Recently completed a reward stay.  That certainly makes it a great stay.  Even so, I would stay here again.  The room was comfortable and clean.  The service was courteous.  And the amenities were all welcome.  I wish there were more dining choices in the area.  Lots of chains around.  The manager's reception and breakfast did very nicely.
Manager Response: Aren't rewards stays the best?  We appreciate your loyalty to Hilton and feel honored you chose to use your rewards stay at our property.  Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: I have never written a review for a hotel, but I couldn't let my amazing experience at the Homewood Suites Anaheim go without recognition. From the second I stepped in the door I was greeted with a smile, and asked all the right questions. In passing, I mentioned that it was my little guys 2nd Birthday and first drip to Disney, he was treated like royalty for the remainder of our stay. The lovely front desk attendants even remembered his name each time we passed by.  Our room was clean, the shuttle service was perfect, breakfast was delicious... I could go on and on.   I just want to say thank you for the amazing visit and for making our little mans Birthday something special. We will definitely see you again.
Manager Response: We love to celebrate special occasions for our guests and I'm glad your son enjoyed his birthday.  For anyone staying with us in the future, please let us know if this is a special occasion and we will celebrate with you. Thanks again.

Summary: We have stayed here a few times and wanted to add to the positive comments. .  This is a very nice, updated hotel with a good breakfast buffet, quiet, no parking problems, nice beds, interior corridors, good location with Oggi's and Red Robin in the parking lot area, across the street from Target. The one bedroom suite is very kid friendly with a table and chairs, apartment size fridg, stove top.  Rooms have granite countertops, flat screen tvs,  and laminate flooring.  Joe Lineaker the manager is the best!  As you can see by his comments, he is very proactive and very concerned about his guests.  This keeps us coming back and Homewood is our hotel of choice!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to submit this review.  We are thrilled that we are your preferred hotel when visiting Disneyland and it means a lot to us that you continue to come back.  We can't wait to see you next time.

Summary Heading: Loved Homewood Suites - You will too!
Summary: We are Grandparents who met our children and 4 and 7 yr old grandchildren at this hotel for a Disneyland vacation 3/27/10 - 4/1/10.  We stayed in a  2-bedroom suite.  Our whole experience from check-in to check-out was perfect.  Staff is friendly, the hotel is clean, rooms are spacious, pool is kept clean, breakfast is more than adequate and the manager's meals on Mondays-Thursdays are satisfying.    Breakfasts change a little daily but consist of eggs, potatoes, one meat (bacon, sausage or ham), bagels, muffins, toast, yogurt, fruit, cold cereals, oatmeal, make your own waffles and any beverage you might want.  This saves a family a lot of money and time.  The manager meals change daily with a different entree choice.  They have a fresh garden salad with tomatoes, cukes,
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your review and for pointing out the value that is included with your room rate at the Homewood Suites Anaheim.

Summary: We have just completed a 10 night stay and would recommended the Homewood suites to everyone, particularly those travelling with small young children.  We booked our accommadation based on Trip Advisor reviews and wish to thank all who recommended this hotel. The rooms were large enough for our family of 5 to relax in comfort and the facilities in general were great. Morning breakfast is a perfect way to begin your assault on Disneyland and I would recommend you get in early if you want a table as it starts to fill up around 8.00am although an adjoining area was opened up during our stay to ensure everyone one was catered for. Don't worry, you won't run out of food as the buffet is constantly stocked. Alternatively you can send one of your party down with the tray that is
Manager Response: Wow, I must say how impressed I am with the detail of your review.  I'm happy your stay was fantastic and look forward to seeing you again.  It was our pleasure to send the package out to you and I hope it arrived unharmed.  Thank you.

Summary: We spent two weeks at the Homewood Suites while visiting Disneyland and LA.    We thought it was a great place to stay. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms were really clean and the staff were very helpful.  The only negative comment is that we arrived a day late due to travel delays and even after 3 phone calls to ensure the room would be available early on out new arrival day as we had prepaid the entire stay they had sold our room for the night as they were fully booked - we were told to come back in two hours but were promised a refund for the room which has never been processed  I would stay there again as the above is a small issue in my opinion.
Manager Response: I'm glad you had a great stay and enjoyed the hotel.  If possible, I would appreciate the opportunity to discuss the refund we promised you and make sure that you have received it.  When it's convenient, please give me a call on my direct line: (714)620-2153.

Summary Heading: Joe Leinacher is an exptional general manager
Summary: This was our 2nd stay at this hotel.  The staff was very courteous and helpful, whether it was the maid or the kitchen workers.  I believe the staff reflects the manager, Joe Leinacker.  Joe is atypical in that he is always visible, asks guests about their stay, and goes "out of his way" to help guests.  Because our flight home was in the early evening, I asked for a late check-out.  Joe asked, " what would be the ideal time for your departure?"   I said, "4PM."  He immediately gave our extended family that check-out time.   That type of responsiveness    leads to great loyalty to a hotel chain.               Jim Jessen,  Campbell, CA.
Manager Response: Mr. Jesson, Thank you very much for your kind words.  We have a great staff that works hard everyday to ensure you enjoy your stay.  We hope you had a safe trip home and hope to see you soon.

Summary: I got to the hotel around 10Pm planning to stay there for 3 nights.  When i arrived the front desk clerk informed me they had been oversold and they had no more rooms and that i needed to change hotels.  I was incensed since the travel site i bokked with needs to garantee a room with a credit card and will charge if we are a no show!  I was told the only choices i had was the Meridian Hotel or the Comfort Inn, which i felt wre both inferior to what i had selected. I informed the clerk i was a prefered Hilton guest and they had to hold the room for me...he said tough this is what it is.  Finally giving up i said ok to the Meridian Hotel, the clerk decided to book the Comfort Inn...ON MY CREDIT CARD.. HE LASO WENT TO THE EXTENT TO INFORM ME THAT I HAD NO CHOICE AND THAT HE HAD
Manager Response: The hotel staff and I are quite sorry that this guest had to experience being relocated to another hotel for one night due to a situation that caused us to be over sold.  While this rarely happens, we try to do everything possible to make sure our guests are taken care of including paying for their night at another hotel and providing transportation.  As I was in this case, I am always willing to assist in anyway possible if the guest allows me.

Summary: We just returned today from a 7 night stay at The Homewood Suites with our kids who are 13 and 16. We have stayed at The Homewood in many locations becasue we usually travel as a family of 5. When planning this trip we decided to stay with the hotel chain we know and like. We are very pleased. From the minute we arrived, early, after travelling since 3:00 am they were friendly and welcoming. The room was spacious and very clean, nice to have 2 tv's and more space than a typical room. The hotel was quiet, despite being very full we never heard noise in the hallways. The beds were comfortable, pillows firm. Every night we enjoyed the hot tub and pool, nicely landscaped and again very clean. The breakfast every morning was a great way to start the day with minimal effort. We really
Manager Response: VancouverTraveler, Hey, I recognize you from your picture!  It was great having you and the family here for a week.  We're thrilled that you had a fantastic stay.  Hope you made it back to Canada safely and look forward to seeing you on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay While Visiting Disneyland
Summary: We recently stayed for 7 nights at the Homewood Suites in March while the family visited Disneylnad.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  This hotel was fantastic all around.  The room was spacious for five of us.  We really enjoyed the suite and we were able to watch TV in the bedroom while the kids played in the living area.  The kitchenette was also nice to have.  The room was clean and in great shape.  The Wi-Fi always worked. The pool and hot tube are huge and the grounds were well kept.   A business center was available and handy for printing out airline boarding passes.  Two huge money saver were the full hot breakfast every morning and the light dinner served Monday-Thursday.  Nothing fancy about the dinners but they were good and filling.  You will not regret staying here
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our 4 night stay at the hotel was great up until checkout but BEWARE if you are booking more than 1 room. We had our stay prepaid through our travel agent but our family did not.  Upon checkout they charged our credit card for our family members room because they did not have a credit card on file for them.   I think that it's wrong for them to 1) assume that because we have the same last name, that they are family and automatically charge our credit card 2) they will not reverse the charge until my in-laws call in with a credit card number when they had already paid for their hotel upon check out.   Needless to say, I WILL NOT be staying there again because of POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!
Manager Response: The hotel made an honest mistake with the billing for this guest.  I have followed up with this guest personally and she was very kind and let us work with her to make up for this error.  She has assured me that we have resolved this issue to her satisfaction and that she will return on her next visit.  We want all of our guests to have a great stay and if for any reason they don't, we want to know about it so that we can make it right.

Summary Heading: Great experience!  Would definitely come back.
Summary: We stayed at the Homewood Suites Anaheim from February 20-27 for our trip to Disnelyand.  Upon check-in I was greeted with a smiling face and excellent service.  I was offered my choice of floors for our room, so based on reviews on this site I took the 1st floor so I wouldn't have to deal with the elevator.  Our room was clean and spacious and fit our needs perfectly.  The beds were comfortable and there was a great selection of pillows to choose from.  Our 5-year-old son decided to make his own bed out of the L part of the sofa so he didn't have to sleep in the same bed as his brother (he kind of made a little fort there out of the couch cushions and was in love!).  The maids picked upon this and started leaving an extra sheet there for him to be more comfortable.  The
Manager Response: StacyB77, Thank you for the kind words about your stay at the Homewood Suites Anaheim.  Cleanliness and superior service are priorities for us and we're glad you found this to be true.   I was surprised about your experience with the PCA shuttle.  We received excessive customer service complaints about our previous shuttle provider and switched due to overwhelming demand.  This is the first negative feedback I have received about PCA and I think guests will notice a significant improvement in shuttle service during high demand periods.  The cost for the PCA shuttle is the same as the ART shuttle.  I will monitor the shuttle service to ensure our guests receive the same level of service we deliver at the hotel. Thanks again and we hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, would absolutely stay here again!
Summary: We booked this hotel for our 2 week vacation to Disneyland based on our friends recent stay on by Tripadvisor reviews.  What a great surprise this place was! We were welcomed and efficiently checked in and loved that everyone had thier own bed.  The kitchen was a great convience to have.  We took advantage of the breakfast every morning and loooooved the waffles!  The evening reception had excellent food and there wasn't one meal we didn't enjoy. The amenities were excellent as well as the staff.  We will be staying here during our next trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Taylorta, We're thrilled you had such a great stay!  We look forward to seeing you on your next visit to Anaheim.  . Best wishes, Joe Leinacker General Manager Homewood Suites Anaheim

Summary: Our family of four including my 11 and 9 year old stayed here for our trip to Disneyland for 5 nights.   I always book my hotels based on the reviews read on this site, and I have to agree that overall the staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We booked a suite with a kitchenette and 2 queen beds.  The only complaint I have was that the beds were smaller than a queen, instead I would say that they were double beds.  I had a very tough time sleeping with my 11 year old because it was so small.  The management tried to accomodate by sending a cot, which has seen better days.  They did immediately send a replacement, which was slightly better, but not much.  Since there wasn't any other choice, I felt that we would just deal with it.  Although I had to listen to my daughter
Manager Response: Coolhand18, Thank you for the kind words about our staff.  We are very fortunate to have such a great group of people working here. I'm sorry the beds weren't to your preference.  The beds are the Homewood Suites standard Serta "Suite Dreams" queen size beds.   Please give me a call before your next trip to the Anaheim area and I will go out of my way to ensure you have an extra special stay. Sincerely, Joe Leinacker  General Manager Homewood Suites Anaheim

Summary: Anaheim is beautiful town with alot to do for any age.  If you are planning on a long vacation or business trip - this is a perfect hotel because they take great care of you...from your transportation to your groceries to the cleanliness of your room and hotel.  The spacious suites give you ample room to relax and unwind or entertain.  The pool and hot tub with its beautiful shrubbery and palm trees make it a perfect place to bask in the sun or visit with friends.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Recently spent one night at this hotel and loved it.  We arrived just after 7pm when the evening reception closed, but they still offered us food and drinks.  The hotel was very quiet and we were able to enjoy the outdoor pool and hot tub - very nice after a night at Downtown Disney!  Great hotel and best value for your money!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here Dec. 6th-11th and loved every minute of it. We were originally going to stay at the Candy Cane Inn as we have for the past several years but we opted to stay at the Homewood Suites because we had such a wonderful experience at the San Diego property during the first leg of our trip. My husband, 3 year old and I loved this property - while not next door to Disneyland, you are a short 5-10 minute shuttle ride away.  It was so convenient to have a small kitchen to use, however, because breakfast and dinner were provided we didn't need the kitchen very much. We enjoyed this property and look forward to staying here for many years to come.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have stayed at many different hotels in the Anaheim area over the years, but this is by far the BEST!  The rooms are very spacious and clean.  The staff is extremely friendly.  The breakfast is wonderful.  And if you happen to stay on Monday thru Thursday, there's even dinner!!!  My whole family just absolutely loved our stay here.  My 3 year old even claimed that she wanted to live in this hotel forever.  We can't wait for our next trip to Disneyland so we can stay at this hotel again!
Manager Response: Our goal is that all of our guests have this kind of experience at our hotel.  Thank you for the kind words.

Summary: We travelled from the UK to stay at these Suites for a week at the end of October and thought this hotel was great.   It was very comfortable, relaxed, the rooms were clean, well presented and spacious, couldnt ask for more.  The hotel staff were very friendly and efficient, the complimentary breakfast was a great start to the day, especially the waffles, which you make yourself - superb!  The hot tub at the end of the day was lovely and with free internet access (a couple of computers available near the reception) the kids kept in touch with friends back home.  We also enjoyed the manger's evening reception a couple of evenings, and although limited in food choice, having free wine and beer a couple of nights was an added bonus.  Furthermore, considering its location, so close
Manager Response: none

Summary: I used hilton honor points for our 5 day stay, so this was definetly priced right. The hotel is a great value if you take advantage of the free breakfast and mon-thur evening dinners for your family. The only downside are the crowds at the meals, very crowded.  We chose to drive to disney one day and take the shuttle the next. Driving worked out the best, $14 per car to park at Disney parking gagrage vs $4 pp for shuttle. They tell you shuttle runs every 25-30 min but be prepared to wait for 2 shuttles because they fill up. Our ride home from the park on our last night was quite eventful. A passenger said something to the bus driver while getting on the bus that set her off. I have never witnessed anyone drop [--] you" so many times than the bus driver did and the bus was full
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for 5 nights with 2 children. Did all the parks, as you do. Great having the bus leave from infront every half hour or so. Lots of restaurants close by. Service was 2nd to none. Room was clean and tidy.
Manager Response: none

Summary: What a fantastic Hotel - Each year i take a group of 6 staff up to LA for an end of year trip and each year i walk away feeling very impressed with this Hotel. Having stayed at some of the most luxury resorts worldwide you simply cant beat this on value for money. The staff are fantastic even to the point of having a few fun nights with them towrads the end of the trip. Location is perfect, rooms are massive and all in all - we'll be back same time next year.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to recuperate from Disney!
Summary: We stayed here based on previous reviews from family.  This hotel was great.  The staff was very attentive.  Rooms were clean and quiet.  We usually stay at Embassy Suites, but stayed here this time.  Having a full kitchen and refrigerator was great when we got home late from the park.  Breakfast was great.  I can not say enough.  I always choose my hotels based on Trip Advisor reviews, and this one is right on.  We have an 8 year old and 12 year old.  There was plenty of space for all for of us.  Comfortable rooms and beds were a bonus after long days.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: It couldn't have better, simply perfect!
Summary: This was the best hotel we have stayed in in all of Anaheim. The rooms are large and roomy with all the comforts of home. The great morning breakfast and yummy lite dinner was perfect and saved us a lot of money. We didn't have time to use the pool. The staff was always super friendly. The grounds were kept nicely and the lobby/common areas are inviting. I will certainly stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family & I stayed here for a week & found it to be fantastic.  Close to Disneyland with shuttle service every 20 min.  Rooms were spotless, comfortable & had everything we needed.  Staff were fantastic & very friendly.  Buffet breakfast was lovely & Mon - Thurs evenings they serve "Manager's snack' which is really great & saves going out for dinner, especially when the kids are tired!  Pool was lovely & clean.  Would definitely go back again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were looking for a hotel that was close to Disneyland and found this to be a pretty good option. Check in was probably the fastest I've ever expierenced. The manager remembered my name the entire trip which was a nice touch. The suite was spacious with enough room for my sons crib in the living room. The complimentary breakfast was also very good. I would say about as a good as your average Vegas buffet. Asked the front desk some questions about transportation/things to do which they were always able to answer. Check out was about as fast as the check-in.  My only complaint would come from the expired soda we purchased from their sundries shop. We bought the soda on the way out and didn't open it until hours later. Not a big deal just kind of weird.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose this hotel because it is close to Disney Land.  We stayed a week and really enjoyed the hotel amenities!  To our suprise, they offer a great dinner Mon-Thurs with a salad bar, beer and wine each night.  The dinner is complimentary as is the breakfast which is great as well.  The hotel was VERY busy so the elevators took forever and the pool was really cold.  Having stayed for a week we needed to do laundry and it was nice to see that the hotel had several washers and dryers.  We've stayed at hundreds of hotels and it it usually a hassle to get laundry done because most hotels don't have enough washers and dryers.  Would def. stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Homewood have the best suites available in my opinion. All the amenities you could need, decent beds, very clean, huge pool. The internet was a HUGE problem as wireless was atrociously slow if you could get connected at all. Front desk didn't really seem to care. Apart from that, GREAT place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife, myself and my family have all stayed at the Homewood time and time again on trips to Disneyland. We have always found the Homewood to be very impressive.  Great rooms, very clean, great breakfast, great shuttle bus to disneyland, great price and great staff. Simply GREAT!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay.  No complaints here!
Summary: We stayed at the Homewood Suites from July 11-19.  We traveled with  2 adults and 2 teenagers.  I did a lot of research and saw that this was one of the highest rated hotels in the Anaheim area.  The Homewood Suites did live up to it's expectations.  We flew in and arrived mid day.  Check in was fast and very easy.  I was worried about the comments listed here regarding the slow elevators.  Lucky us we were placed in the first floor!  (I didn't even ask but was prepared to ask for a lower floor).  This is very convenient to everything the hotel has to offer.  Breakfast right around the corner, pool right there too.  Parking right outside our window.  Our room had two queen beds and a sofa bed in the living room.  Rooms have a fridge, 2 burner stove, dishwasher, dishes and
Manager Response: none

One word of warning though, take care at breakfast around the waffle makers - it's a zoo. Unless you're a big fan of them (I'm not but my kids are) give them a miss.

Summary Heading: Great value for money - totally recommend for families

They offer a free breakfast buffet which was quite good. They also offer a light dinner but we were never there to take advantage of it.  The hotel staff was great and even volunteered to take our laundry out of the dryer and bring it to our room so that we wouldn't miss the 9:00 shuttle to Disney one morning. The shuttle was great. They stop right in front of the hotel and are very helpful with strollers if you have young ones. They run every 1/2 hour back and forth and you get dropped off right at the Disney entrance. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family recently spent 7 nights in this hotel. We had paid in advance and asked for a room with a view. They said "no problem" However when we arrived we were told that there was a convention in town, and there was only one room left. So instead of saving a room with a view for us, (being that we had prepaid in full and made the request a month in advance) we were checked into a room on the second floor which looked out onto another wall and the central air conditioning unit. All night our wall shook, and the lamps on the walls rattled. In the morning we asked to be moved, and were told "no problem"again, and that they would move our things while we went sightseeing. Upon our return we did find our things moved, but it was confusing that no one seemed to know where they had

Summary: We visited Disneyland over the Labor Day holiday, checking in a few days before on August 30, 2003. It was my mom and sister's first time to Disney and our first real family vacation (me, mom, sis, brother and my 9 year old). I could not have asked for a better place to stay.  Plenty of space for us and our stuff. We stocked the fridge with snacks and water - a welcome sight after a long day of walking at the park.  Kitchen comes with all you need, dishes and cleaning stuff. The staff was great and the breakfast buffet was magnificent. The grounds are beautiful, plenty of parking even with several other hotels sharing the area. Several restaurants are within walking distance and there is a Starbucks in an adjacent hotel. Summary: Plus: - spacious, clean rooms with a living room/kitchen separated from the bedroom by a solid wall and door. Great if you have kids that go to bed early and you want to watch TV, talk, eat, whatever. - one of the best hotel pools I have ever been to. large main pool plus wading pool plus hot tub. Situated away from the street, nice gardening. - friendly front desk, complimentary shuttle service to Disneyland. Minus: - we had called in advance to get two rooms next to each other and were told that was no problem. It was however. We waited almost one hour until they finally had two adjacent rooms available for us.

Summary: We stayed here from june thru the 11th, and it was such a great stay, the rooms are very nice,clean,well maintain and the fact that you have a separate dining and living room is so nice, houseeeping was great, she was very pleasant and nice the entire time we were there, and front desk was very helpful, we have been to Disneyland many times and this has been one of the best hotels we have stayed in.....for sure we are coming back to this hotel next summer.....valerie
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great place to stay.  Rooms are great size w/plenty of space to move around.  Our "one bedroom" suite had 2Q beds plus lots of closet space in bedroom and the "family room" had just as much space for the sofa bed, recliner chair, small table/2 chairs, kitchen that had microwave, 2 burner stove, dishwasher, full size fridge along with plates/utensils, fry pans and more.  Great idea for a limited traveling budget instead of going out to eat every meal (or the convenience of being able to reheat leftovers) or bring snacks for the family.  Hotel is clean and very quiet.  Ample parking for guests.  Breakfast buffet is simple: bagels, yogurt, hot/cold cereal, fresh fruit, hot cocoa, danish.  Avoid the crowd, by taking what you want back to your room to eat/relax.
